interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This change involves the addition of multiple words: "قال الرب" and "للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود," which collectively constitute a significant alteration in the text. Since more than one word is added, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes, as defined in the provided categories.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

The change involves the addition of multiple words: "قال الرب" and "للذين اتو اليه من اليهود," which collectively represent a significant alteration in the text. Since more than one word is added, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change involves the spelling of the verb اتوا, which is altered to اتو by omitting the final alif. This is a change in orthography that does not affect the meaning of the sentence. Similar examples include changes in spelling or the addition/removal of diacritics that do not alter the grammatical function or meaning of the words.
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

The change involves the omission of a single major word, "فكلمهم", which is significant as it alters the meaning of the sentence by removing the action of Jesus speaking to them. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change since the omitted phrase is a complete action and not a minor word or conjunction.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

The change involves the addition of the word "صوته" before "وقال," which constitutes a change across more than one word. The original reading has a single word "وقال," while the new reading has two words "صوته وقال," thus falling under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change involves the substitution of the preposition "الي" with "فى," which does not alter the meaning of the phrase but rather reflects a spelling variation in the use of the preposition. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, where the spelling or orthography is modified without affecting the overall meaning. Similar examples include changes in prepositions or minor spelling adjustments that do not impact the grammatical function or meaning of the words.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

The change involves two words: "الابد" is replaced with "الدهر," which is a significant change as it alters the meaning of the phrase, and "معه" is changed to "له," which also affects the grammatical function. Since both changes occur across multiple words, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

The change involves multiple words: "الابد" is replaced with "الدهر," "تكون" is changed to "يكون," and "معه" is replaced with "له." Since these changes affect more than one word, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves substituting the major word "الابد" with "الدهر," which alters the root of the word and its meaning. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it is a significant alteration to a single word rather than a minor adjustment or orthographic change.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves multiple words: "الابد" is replaced with "للدهر," and "معه" is replaced with "له." Since both changes affect different words, this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves the verb form from تكون to يكون, which is a modification in verb tense and form. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word. The change does not involve multiple words or a significant alteration in meaning.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves the substitution of the word له with معه, which is a minor word (a preposition with a pronominal suffix). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects only one minor word without altering the root of the word or the overall meaning significantly.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves the addition of the preposition ل before الدهر, which is a minor word change. Additionally, the verb يكون is changed to تكون, which is also a minor change as it only affects the form of the verb without altering the root. Both changes are consistent with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as they involve modifications to minor words and do not affect the overall meaning significantly.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves two words: the preposition بل is replaced with the preposition لـ, and the word معه is changed to له. Since both changes affect different words, this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves the addition of the major word نور (light) to the phrase, which alters the meaning significantly by introducing a new concept (light) that is not present in the original reading. The root of the word الحياه (life) remains the same, but the addition of نور makes it a major word change rather than a minor one.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The change involves the addition of the preposition "الي," which is classified as a minor word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it is an addition of a single minor word (a preposition) without altering the root of any major word or changing the overall meaning significantly.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

The change involves multiple words: "اجاب" is omitted, and "يسوع" is moved to the end of the phrase, changing the structure of the sentence. This constitutes a change across more than one word, thus falling under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The change involves the spelling of "ايسوع" being corrected to "يسوع," which is a standardization of spelling without affecting the meaning of the text. This fits the definition of an orthographic change, as it does not alter the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

The change involves the substitution of the conjunction "وقال" with "فقال," which is a minor change affecting the conjunction without altering the overall meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves a single minor word change (the conjunction) rather than a major word or multiple words.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves multiple words: the addition of the word "اجاب" and the rearrangement of the phrase, which includes the retention of "فقال لهم" and the spelling of "ايسوع" remains the same. Since more than one word is altered or added, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves the spelling of "يسوع" to "ايسوع," which is a variation in orthography without affecting the meaning of the text. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it pertains to how the word is written rather than altering its grammatical function or meaning.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The change involves the omission of the minor words "وانتم انما," which includes a conjunction (و) and a particle (انما). The root word "انتم" remains unchanged, and the alteration does not affect the grammatical function or meaning significantly, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

The change involves the omission of the entire phrase ⸂ايما تقضون⸃, which constitutes a significant alteration as it removes a complete major word unit from the text. This phrase is not a minor word or a conjunction; it carries substantial meaning within the context. Therefore, the omission qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

The change involves the addition of the major word تقضوا, which is a significant alteration as it introduces a new verb form that is not merely a minor word or particle. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where the root of the word is different from the omitted text.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change involves the substitution of the minor word "اما" with "و" and the pronoun "انا" remains the same. Since "اما" is a conjunction and "وانا" includes the conjunction "و" followed by the pronoun "انا," this fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it only affects a single minor word (the conjunction) while the root of the pronoun remains unchanged.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The change involves the omission of the conjunction و and the interrogative particle ما, resulting in a simpler form of the phrase. This alteration affects only a minor word (the conjunction and the interrogative particle) without changing the root or the grammatical function of the remaining words. Similar examples include the omission of minor words such as conjunctions or particles.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word change. The rest of the phrase remains unchanged, and the addition does not alter the root or grammatical structure of the words involved. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Minor_Word_Change, where a minor word (in this case, the conjunction ف) is added to a single phrase.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word. This aligns with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves the addition of a single minor word without altering the root or grammatical structure of the remaining words.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word change since it does not alter the root or grammatical structure of the main content of the phrase. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Minor_Word_Change, where the addition of a conjunction is considered a minor alteration.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is a minor word change. The rest of the phrase remains the same, with only the alif of nasb being omitted from احدا, which is also considered a minor change. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves the modification of a single minor word (the conjunction) and a minor alteration to a single word (the omission of the alif).
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the omission of the alif in the word احدا, which is an orthographic alteration that does not affect the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthography, where changes in spelling or orthography are noted without altering the meaning. Similar examples include the addition or omission of an alif as a marker of the accusative.
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the omission of the alif of nasb in the word أحدًا, which is a spelling alteration that does not affect the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a modification in spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the substitution of the word ⸂لاني⸃ with two words ⸂هو لان⸃, which constitutes a change across more than one word. Since the change affects the meaning and involves multiple words, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change involves the substitution of the verb لست (I am not) with ليس (is not), which is a minor word change as it affects the verb form but does not change the root of the word or the overall meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where a single minor word is altered without affecting the root or the grammatical structure significantly.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change involves the substitution of the verb form "ليست" (which is in the negative form) with "ليس," which is a minor word change as it affects the verb tense but does not change the root of the word or the overall meaning. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where a minor word (in this case, a verb) is altered without affecting the root or the grammatical function significantly.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change from ⸂ولكني⸃ to ⸂لكنى⸃ involves a spelling alteration where the letter 'و' is replaced with 'ل' and the diacritic on the final letter changes, but the meaning remains the same. This fits the definition of orthographic changes, as it does not affect the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The change involves the omission of a single major word, "حق," which is significant in meaning and represents a different root word. According to the definitions provided, this qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change since the reading is altered by the absence of a major word rather than a minor word or orthographic adjustment.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The change involves the addition of the minor word هي, which is a pronoun and does not alter the root or the major meaning of the word حق. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it is an addition to a single minor word without affecting the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change from ⸂انا⸃ to ⸂وانا⸃ involves the addition of the conjunction و to the pronoun, which is a minor word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it only affects a single minor word (the pronoun) without altering the root or the grammatical function significantly.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The change involves the omission of the single major word نفسى, which is significant as it represents a key concept in the sentence. The omission alters the meaning of the phrase, indicating that it is a major word change rather than a minor one. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Major_Word_Change, where the omission of a significant word is categorized as such.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change from ⸂على ذلك⸃ to ⸂لي ذلك⸃ involves substituting the preposition "على" with "لي," which alters the root of the word and its grammatical function. This is a significant change as it affects the meaning of the phrase, thus qualifying it as a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

The change involves replacing the phrase ⸂على ذلك⸃ with ⸂لي وهو⸃, which consists of two distinct words. This constitutes a change across multiple words, as both the preposition and the demonstrative pronoun are altered, thus falling under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change involves substituting the minor word ذلك with وهو. Both words serve as demonstrative pronouns, and the change does not affect the root of the word or the overall meaning significantly. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where a minor word is substituted without altering the grammatical structure or meaning in a substantial way.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع, which is a change in orthography without affecting the meaning of the word. This aligns with the definition of the Orthography category, as it involves alterations to how the word is written.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

The change involves substituting the conjunction ف with و in the phrase, which is a minor alteration that does not affect the overall meaning of the sentence. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves a modification to a single minor word (the conjunction) without altering the root or grammatical function of the phrase.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change from ⸂كان يكلمهم⸃ to ⸂كلمهم⸃ involves the omission of the auxiliary verb كان, which is a major word that alters the grammatical structure and meaning of the phrase. The root of the verb changes from a compound form (كان يكلم) to a simple form (كلم), indicating a significant alteration in the verb's tense and aspect. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where the root of the word is different.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change involves the spelling of "ساعته" to "ساعه," which is a modification in orthography without affecting the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, where alterations to spelling do not change the grammatical function or meaning of the words.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change involves the spelling of the word "ساعته" to "الساعه," where the definite article "ال" is added to the word "ساعه." This is a change in orthography as it does not affect the meaning of the phrase but rather standardizes the spelling. Similar examples include changes where articles are added or omitted without altering the meaning of the words.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

The change involves two words: "لان" is replaced with "اذ" and "ساعه" is replaced with "كانت". Both changes affect the meaning and structure of the phrase, thus qualifying it as a change across multiple words.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

The change involves substituting the major word "بلغت" with "اقتربت," which alters the root of the verb, indicating a significant change in meaning. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it involves a single word that is more significant than a minor word and has a different root. The other word "تكن" remains unchanged, but the focus is on the major word change.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change involves the verb form "تكون" being altered to "تكن," which is a modification in the verb tense or form but does not change the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it is a single minor word change affecting the verb form without altering its root.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The change involves substituting the verb "تكون" with "تكن," which is a different form of the same root, and replacing "اقتربت" with "اتت," which is a different root word altogether. Since the root of "اقتربت" is different from "اتت," this qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change.

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.

The change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is replaced with "انطلق," "وفي" is replaced with "ولا," and "تطلبوني" is modified to "تطلبونى." Since these changes affect more than one word, they fall under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The change involves the omission of the minor word و (which is a conjunction), resulting in the phrase ⸂خطاياكم⸃. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it only affects a single minor word without altering the root or the grammatical function of the remaining words.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

The change involves replacing the phrase ⸂خطاياكم⸃ with ⸂تجدونى وباثمكم⸃, which consists of two distinct words (تجدونى and باثمكم) that are entirely different in meaning and structure. This qualifies as a change across multiple words, as both the content and the number of words have changed. Therefore, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change involves the substitution of the verb form "تموتون" with "تموتوا," which is a modification in the verb form but does not change the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering its root.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The change involves substituting the major word انطلق with the major word اذهب. Since both words have different roots and convey distinct meanings, this qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

The change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is replaced with "انطلق," and "فانتم" is added, which constitutes a change across more than one word. Both "اذهب" and "انطلق" are major words, and the addition of "فانتم" further confirms that this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

The change involves two words: the negation "ليس" is replaced with "لا," and the verb "تاتون" is changed to "تجون." Both changes affect the meaning and involve different words, thus falling under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

The change involves the verb form from تقدرو to تقدرون, which is a modification in the verb tense and form, specifically changing the second person plural form to the present tense plural form. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word. The other words in the phrase remain unchanged.
c.f. ليس تقدرو تاتوا ➞ ليس تقدرون تاتوا

The change involves multiple words: "ليس" is replaced with "لا," "تاتوا" is replaced with "تجون," and the verb form is altered. Since more than one word is changed, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتوا ➞ لا تقدرون تجون
The form of the verb قالوا is changed to قال

The change involves the addition of the interrogative particle ما, which is classified as a minor word. This aligns with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it pertains to the addition of a single minor word without altering the root or grammatical structure of the surrounding text.
c.f. OMIT ➞ ما
The minor word ان is added.
The form of تاتوا is changed to تاتون.
The pronoun انتم is omitted.
The pronoun انتم is changed to ان and the form of the verb تاتون is changed to تاتوا. Both are minor changes but taken together, they are a changes to multiple words.

The change involves the substitution of the pronoun "انتم" with the particle "ان," which is a minor word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves the alteration of a single minor word (the pronoun) without affecting the root of the word or the overall meaning of the phrase. Similar examples include changes to conjunctions or pronouns that do not alter the core meaning of the sentence.
